$interpreted: Sherlock: Come~ All kinds of rare and obscure treasure can be found here. Come see for yourself~
Lisa: My dear father~ how's business today?
Sherlock: Hoho, booming as usual, of course. Today, I sold a shipment of Prickear Monkey fur to the lizard nobles for twice the market price! Jackpot~
Lisa: I expect no less from father!
Lisa: To be honest, I came across this really beautiful dress when I went shopping with Emily a while ago...
Sherlock: No need to continue. I get it.
Lisa: Yay~ thank you, father! I love you so much!
Sherlock: Of course, I am your dearest daddy after all...
Sherlock: ... Hmm...
Lisa: What's the matter? Is something wrong with your body?
Sherlock: The mechanical joints in my shoulder are a bit rusty...
Lisa: Must be because you haven't oiled them in a long time. I'll go buy you some motor oil. Wait here!
Lisa: Owner, same as always. One can of top-quality motor oil.
Shopkeeper: Sure thing~ just a moment.

Thug: Hey there, pretty~ what are you buying?
Let me help you carry it~
Lisa: I'm fine on my own. My father's booth is just nearby. Please, go away.

Thug: Aww~ don't be a party pooper.
Let big bro here teach you something fun~
Lisa: I said GO AWAY! Quit bugging me!
Thug: What, you wanna be a hero, punk?

Ned: The lady's already asked you to leave. 
You can quit now before I get serious.
Thug: You think you're gonna interrupt my fun! Take this!
Lisa: You piece of... I'll help you out!
Thug: Oww... you, you better not forget this! I'll be back!
Ned: Miss, are you alright?
Lisa: Not a scratch. It was all thanks to you, handsome fella...
Lisa: Hey~ since it's fate that we met here, let's go grab a drink together. I have plenty~ to offer, you know~
Ned: No thanks. I'm not fond of alcohol.
Lisa: Eh!?
Lisa: Did you not hear me clearly? I mean a drink, together, with me...
Ned: Thank you for asking, but no thanks. If nothing else, allow me to take my leave.

Lisa: I got turned down?
That's impossible; every single man in the Bazaar wants to date me...

Lisa: Hmph, he is a man after all.
No way he can resist my char...
Ned: This is just a personal suggestion, but you should wear more clothes. Your outfit is too revealing and barely covers the important parts.
Ned: You should go back and add some more clothing. That way, you won't get a cold.
Ned: That's all I wanted to say. Goodbye.

Shopkeeper: Lisa, the motor oil will be 80 Curren...
... Lisa?
Lisa: Never imagined there exist a man who can resist my charm... not to mention he's an honest, handsome fella too...

Shopkeeper: Lisa? Lisa~?
The motor oil is 80 Curren. Did you hear me?
Lisa: I smell great potential in him. Better do a background check ASAP!
Shopkeeper: Lisa~ you forgot your motor oil~ HEY!
